DarkHawk/PErceptor:

PErceptor Continue monitoring Ratrap, hoping to get hi=
m out the pipers.


***********************

Darkhawk Smiled devilish and s=
aid, "that could be true, Scrapling, but awhat about if I torture a fellow =
first infront of your eyes... Ahhh Sorry, you cant see " he added on purpos=
e that expresion jsut to hurt him "does your autobot Honor allow you that?"=



From: Sandy 
Sent: Wednesday, February 24, 2010 10:30 PM
To: nbwrpg@yaho=
ogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Rat Trap ha=
d hardly enough time to dart out of the way of Cyclonus's energy blast, whe=
n he suddenly catches Lord Elder's transmission, as he jumps to avoid a sec=
ond hit.

"LORD ELDER! AM I GLAD TA HEAR YOUR VOICE BECAUSE I CAN REALLY US=
E SOME BACK UP HERE! I ENDED UP IN THE PREDACON BASE, AND GUESS WHAT?! I ME=
T AN AUTOBOT WHO'S RELATED TA OPTIMUS PRIME! HE'S IN MORE TROUBLE THAN I AM=
, AND HE'S SENDN' ME OUT FOR HELP, QUESTION IS, GETTN' OUTA THIS SNAKE PIT =
OF A BASE WITHOUT GETTN' MY AFT BLOWN OFF!"

He starts to send Lord Elder t=
he data relating to his position and location.

"Sorry, I had ta yell becau=
se of the sound of the energy blasts. Okay, here's the skinny sir, we got t=
hree trapped Autobots. Night Light who's unconcious, my new pal, Tucson, wh=
o came here tryn' ta save Rodimus's life, even though that lousey heap of s=
crap doesn't deserve it for the treachery he's committed lately and yeah I =
am reffern' ta Rodimus Prime. ACK! Lousey no good GLITCH! Look, I'll tell y=
a more when I can get outa here, that's if I get outa here."

His transmiss=
ion breaks after his last word.

At the torture chamber, Tucson's only reac=
tion to Scorpinok is a cold one. He was NOT about to divulge anything to an=
yone, no matter the pain of the torture!

" Truthfully, you can intimidate =
me all you want, but I will Not betray the Autobots and the good name of Op=
timus Prime. So if you're looking for me to tell you everything, forget it,=
 you will not get that out of me no matter if you dismantle me piece by pie=
ce while I'm still alive." 

He turns his head away from Scorponok.

By the=
 Ark..

OOC: Enter Quickstride.

BIC: Quickstride may not have been the bri=
ghtest Maximal on the force, but he knew when a rescue had to be made. He h=
ears Rat Trap's transmission with ears forward in equine form, and hangs hi=
s head over Lord Elder's shoulder, while chewing on some vegitation that he=
 had found in the area, as all horses do while grazing. He swallows a mouth=
 full of chewed up greens and thoughtfully looks to Lord Elder.

" I know d=
istress when I hear it. And Rat Trap definitely sounded like he needs help.=
 Lord Elder, with your permission I'd like to volunteer my services."

Repl=
ies the Stallion thoughtfully, looking to Lord Elder with big blue eyes, wh=
ich was rare among horses. Breezes catch his long copper mane and tail as h=
e swatts away insects with it. 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Car=
roll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> OOC: Enter Lord Elder!
> 
> In the cent=
er of the Ark's main command center Lord Elder, the leader
> of the Watcher=
s and at the moment, the lone guardian of the Ark stood
> watching differen=
t computer screens, indulging one his favorite past
> times, examining the =
cosmos. From as far back as he could remember he
> had always had a fascina=
tion with anything new, the stars, new
> planets, new places, he was a mach=
ine designed to explore.
> 
> On the screens were different views of space,=
 a few of them were
> centered on the moon, as he silently wondered exactly=
 what was going
> on there, what were the minions planning? Unfortunately h=
e had no
> ability to peer into their very base, although he could at times=
 make
> out the dim reddish reflections from the moon, the base of Unicron'=
s
> minions.
> 
> With a sigh he looked at another monitor, this one traine=
d in a
> different direction. He couldn't necessarily see the Predacon base=

> from his position, but he knew where it was and he always kept a
> senso=
r beam in their direction. Even with the ongoing skirmishes from
> the mini=
ons, you can never put it past the Predacons to make an attack
> as well.
>=
 
> He pursed his lips slightly as he looked at the screen. He had seen
> R=
at Trap going off in that direction. He hadn't said anything to the
> Maxim=
al, as Rat Trap was usually more than able to take care of
> himself, but i=
t had been a while since he had checked in.
> 
> With a casual movement Lor=
d Elder reached down to the console in front
> of him and opened an encrypt=
ed maximal channel, "Rat Trap! This is
> Lord Elder, come it. What is your =
Status?"
> 
> (Tag)
> 
> Preston
> (Lord Elder)
>
